intro: Pedicularis siphonantha var. stictochila, commonly known as the alpine lousewort, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its parasitic or hemiparasitic relationship with host plants. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils. Its flowers are usually bright red or orange, with a spurred structure that aids in pollination by insects. The leaves are often small and opposite, adapted to the harsh conditions of its high-altitude habitat.
